entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Expected This Week... Rain continues over the northeast Brooks Range east of the Dalton Highway. entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast; Northeastern Brooks Range

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:41AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Into Friday... Around 1 inch of rain fell from Wednesday evening through early Wednesday afternoon in the southeast Brooks Range. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:41PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Runoff from heavy rain in the Brooks Range late last week is moving down the Koyukuk River. The crest of high water is expected to reach Huslia from Wednesday into Thursday. This high water will cause erosion of the Koyukuk River bank at Huslia. entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 15 at 2:02PM CDT until June 15 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms are forecast through this evening, mainly for areas along and south of Interstate 20. Thunderstorm activity will produce locally heavy rainfall, with the potential for repeated heavy rains over the same areas. Over the last few days, 2 to 5 inches of rain has fallen in some areas. An additional 1 to 2 inches is possible through this evening.

entry.summary: .Moderate to heavy rain is likely to fall across portions of central and north-central WY from Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. Amounts from 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected.
